Sentencas: (La,Sr)(Co,Fe)O3-delta is very common as cathode material in SOFC applications.
Titulo: Thermodynamic perspective of Sr-related degradation issues in SOFCs

Sentencas: Sr in this type of cathode material is very reactive to form secondary phases with other oxides, which affect micro-structures and properties of the cathode materials, GDC layers and ZrO2-based electrolytes.
Titulo: Thermodynamic perspective of Sr-related degradation issues in SOFCs

Sentencas: The Sr-related degradation issues, Cr poisoning and volatile Sr species formation, are studied.
Titulo: Thermodynamic perspective of Sr-related degradation issues in SOFCs

Sentencas: As supplement to existing experimental knowledge on Cr poisoning, specific thermodynamic aspects for Cr poisoning are discussed.
Titulo: Thermodynamic perspective of Sr-related degradation issues in SOFCs

Sentencas: The thermodynamic calculations show that the partial pressure pCrO(3) has a stronger temperature dependence than pCrO(2)(OH)(2), and when considering the reaction between SrO and CrO3(g), dependent on different pCrO(3) and pO(2), different Sr-Cr-O compounds SrCrO4, SrCrO3, Sr3Cr2O8 or Sr2CrO4 could be formed.
Titulo: Thermodynamic perspective of Sr-related degradation issues in SOFCs

Sentencas: In addition, thermodynamic calculations show that in the presence of water vapor, formation of volatile Sr(OH)(2) is possible as well.
Titulo: Thermodynamic perspective of Sr-related degradation issues in SOFCs

Sentencas: pSr(OH)(2) depends on temperature, pH(2)O and SrO activity and can be of the same order of magnitude as pCrO(2)(OH)(2).
Titulo: Thermodynamic perspective of Sr-related degradation issues in SOFCs

Sentencas: Volatile Sr(OH)(2) can diffuse through the porous GDC layer and react with ZrO2-based electrolytes to form SrZrO3 precipitates.
Titulo: Thermodynamic perspective of Sr-related degradation issues in SOFCs

Sentencas: The reaction between gaseous Sr species and 8YSZ sheet is studied experimentally.
Titulo: Thermodynamic perspective of Sr-related degradation issues in SOFCs

Sentencas: The surface of the 8YSZ sheet is investigated by SEM coupled with EDS, confirming the deposition of Sr.
Titulo: Thermodynamic perspective of Sr-related degradation issues in SOFCs
